greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into composite parts.
comment: First differences of A002095. - _Emeric Deutsch_, Apr 03 2006
a(n+1) > a(n) for n > 108. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 22 2007
link: Reinhard Zumkeller and Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5000 (terms n = 0..150 from Reinhard Zumkeller)
maple: b(n, i-1)+ `if`(i>n or isprime(i), 0, b(n-i, i))))
mathematica: Composite[n_Integer] := FixedPoint[n + PrimePi[ # ] + 1 &, n + PrimePi[n] + 1]; CoefficientList[ Series[1/Product[1 - x^Composite[i], {i, 1, 50}], {x, 0, 75}], x]

b[n_, i_] := b[n, i] = If[n==0, 1, If[i<2, 0, b[n, i-1] + If[i>n || PrimeQ[i], 0, b[n-i, i]]]]; a[n_] := b[n, n]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 70}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 16 2017, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
program: p ks'@(k:ks) m = if m < k then 0 else p ks' (m - k) + p ks m
results.author: _Olivier Gérard_
